duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure compliance with regulatory, contractual requirements, and security policies such as CMMC, NIST 800-171, and government contractual obligations.
Translate regulatory and contractual requirements into process and system impacts and functional requirements.
Develop controls, conduct effectiveness testing, and support audit activities.
Identify and manage remediation activities, prepare reports, provide input to compliance strategies, propose security tools, and process changes.
Build strong working relationships and partnerships within own organization and across technology and business teams.
Work with multi-functional groups to create and test procedures, standard or regulatory controls to ensure the security and privacy of information.
Participate in information security review of new technologies, designs, and remediation planning efforts.
Investigate potential compliance failures, identify security needs, and recommend plans/resolutions.
Support the collection and documentation of an accurate inventory of technology, processes, and people required to align with regulations, industry standards, and company policies.
Contribute to security projects driven by groups both internal and external to info security.
Other Duties/Projects as assigned by business management as needed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology, or equivalent experience (Master's preferred)
CISM, CISSP, and CISA certifications are preferred
